quotes.quote: Be gracious to all men, but choose the best to be your friends.
Gracious self is the divinity within.
Kindness is gracious demonstrate sensitivity and human warmth.
The people who tend to be the most gracious are those who know how badly they need grace.
God is gracious to some very peculiar people.
A sweet lie is more gracious for us than a virulent but real truth.
The real champions in life are so humble and gracious. They just continue doing what they do without all the posturing. If you've got the real thing, you don't have to flaunt a loud imitation.
How gracious to forgive the people who hurt you.
Gracious words refresh, restore and revive the soul.
Gracious living is felt whether it is created in small or big ways.

Your graciousness is what carries you. It isn't how old you are, how young you are, how beautiful you are, or how short your skirt is. What it is, is what comes out of your heart. If you are gracious, you have won the game.
It is compassion, the most gracious of virtues, Which moves the world.
A gracious soul may look through the darkest cloud and see God smiling on him.

Gracious acceptance is an art—an art which most never bother to cultivate. We think that we have to learn how to give, but we forget about accepting things, which can be much harder than giving... Accepting another person's gift is allowing him to express his feelings for you.
Be pretty if you can, be witty if you must, but be gracious if it kills you.
God is gracious beyond the power of language to describe.
There is hardly a more gracious gift that we can offer somebody than to accept them fully, to love them almost despite themselves.
If a man be gracious and courteous to strangers, it shows he is a citizen of the world.
Be gracious in your giving for as long as you're living. The blessings will come back on an unexpected day, and present themselves in an unexpected way.
God is gracious to always give a warning before He sends judgment.
To refuse graciously is to confer a favor.
Hope is a gracious expectation.
Life is a gracious gift.
We can graciously survive life by faith.
It is gracious to have old people full of vitality and endowed with wisdom in our society.
You learn how to be a gracious winner and an outstanding loser.
